Ocena 95/100

This is truly one of the best games I have ever played. Let's just say there's a reason why this is the highest-rated game on Steam. From the story to the settings to the mechanics to the music this is simply phenomenal. Condensing my thoughts into one short review won't do this game justice so allow me to gush about it for several paragraphs instead...

Portal 2 takes the beloved formula from the original game and expands on it in all the right ways. In comparison to the original, this game is much more story-orientated, however this certainly doesn't stop other elements from standing out. In fact, literally any of the other elements in this game may be its defining characteristic to you.

As stated, the story is the main focus here, and it certainly doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Hitting all the right beats with powerful perfectly timed moments and humorous writing which is smart, witty and very entertaining. It makes you feel a connection to the characters (which are all brilliant) and keeps you hooked throughout. The soundtrack is amazing and helps to add atmosphere to anywhere you go in the game.

The mechanics are cleverly designed to fit the story events and puzzles to more naturally teach you how to play. Aside from the normal Portals and other minor things, there is a wide variety of mechanics available such as Aerial Faith Plates, Redirection Cubes, Hard Light Bridges, Excursion Funnels and a range of Gels.

For a 2011 game, the graphics still look great. Taking place within the Aperture Science Enrichment Centre, the game switches environments repeatedly. From the decrepit (then refurbished) modern facility to the abandoned old facility, the game features a varied collection of detailed and breathtaking settings, all of varying size and ingenuity.

There is also a 2-player co-op mode filled with new and unique puzzles to play with a friend as well as many community-made Workshop maps to keep you going for days on end.

The only negative things about this game that I see are in the puzzles themselves. Some puzzles take mere seconds while others take a lot longer to complete. Portal 2 also doesn‚Äôt use its space as well as its predecessor. While this lends to larger and more detailed test chambers, it can be seen as wasted potential.

If you haven't played the first Portal yet then definitely go do that first; it'll increase your overall enjoyment of this game (and series) even more. [i]Please[/i], just go play this [strike]game[/strike] masterpiece right now. [b]10/10[/b].
this game is amazing i would 100% recommend this game any of my friends 10/10. i liked the you can play with your friends or play solo

If you and your friend are annoyed with CSGO and other FPS games, try this to help you relax. Trust me, this is seriously worth your time.
